newsitem.title: USA: Safeguard to give 3rd rights offering of '96.
newsitem.headline: Safeguard to give 3rd rights offering of '96.

text.p: Safeguard Scientifics Inc's president and chief operating officer said the company will announce third rights offering from its investment portfolio before year end.
The Wayne, Pa.-based company has already announced two offerings this year, including one for Sanchez Computer Associates, which is scheduled to occur Thursday.
"We will announce one more (this year)," Donald Caldwell, Safeguard's president, told the Atlanta Society of Financial Analysts today.
However, Caldwell added that the offering will not occur until next year. He did not identify the company involved.

Safeguard is a publicly traded venture capital firm that invests primarily in young information technology companies. After an appropriate incubation period, these companies are brought public through shareholder rights offerings.
For example, Safeguard's shareholders are to receive one transferable right to buy one share of Sanchez for every ten shares of Safeguard common stock owned, the company said.
Caldwell said that beginning in 1997 the company plans to announce three rights offerings a year.
